title: Ticket #6869: scitokens: Abandon ZKM_QUERY_CREDS
description:
Looking at the RPC protocol (ZKM_QUERY_CREDS) between condor_submit and the condor_credd for token submission, I have come to the conclusion it is unfixable:

  • There is no mechanism for an error message to be passed or for the credd to otherwise indicate an error has occurred.
  • It's named ZKM_QUERY_CREDS.
  • It's narrowly limited to the web workflow, which is not necessarily always going to be the case.

The code is 90% salvageable, however, as we simply just need to tweak the protocol to make it more flexible. I propose we instead:

  • Create a new command int that is not literally named after the developer.
  • In the new command int, we have it respond with a ClassAd instead of a string. This should allow for error messages, among other things.
  • Do the normal protocol evolution based on the version of the remote condor_credd.

By responding with a ClassAd, we can indicate that condor_submit should respond to missing credentials by having the job start off on hold -- and we can record which credentials are missing!

Once we evolve this protocol slightly, we have more flexibility to do things like make OAuth tokens compatible with Pegasus and provide a reasonable Python binding to the credd.
